name: Assembly-Info-Task
description: Set assembly manifest data such as Version, Copyright and Trademark etc.
author: Bleddyn Richards

inputs.name: Path
inputs.label: Source folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Source folder for the 'AssemblyInfo.cs' file, can be root as it will find all files recursively.

inputs.name: Title
inputs.label: Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a title name for the assembly.

inputs.name: Product
inputs.label: Product
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the product information for the assembly e.g. Product of Example.com

inputs.name: Description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a detailed description of the product or modules that comprise the assembly e.g. Property of Example.com

inputs.name: Company
inputs.label: Company
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the company information for the assembly e.g. Example Ltd

inputs.name: Copyright
inputs.label: Copyright
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the assembly or product copyright information e.g. Copyright Â© $(date:yyyy) Example Ltd

inputs.name: Trademark
inputs.label: Trademark
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the assembly or product trademark information e.g. Example.com

inputs.name: Culture
inputs.label: Culture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide information on what language the assembly supports.

inputs.name: Configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the build configuration for the assembly, such as debug or release.

inputs.name: VersionNumber
inputs.label: Version Number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the file and assembly version.
 e.g. $(Build.BuildNumber) or $(date:yyyyMMdd)$(rev:.r)
